description.narrative: Projektförslaget som presenterats av Europarådet, "Immediate Measures Package", är en respons på utvecklingen i Ukraina 2013-2014. Projektförslaget innehåller mål och aktiviteter för att omgående stärka respekten för normer och processer kring demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter. Aktiviteterna omfattar stöd till arbetet med konstitutionen, utredningar kring brott mot mänskliga rättigheter, processer för ökad lokal demokrati; val; samt kapacitetsutveckling av parlamentsledamöter.

The intervention is titled CoE Immediate Measures Package proposed in the wake of the civic protests in Ukraine over 2013-2014. The package includes the emergency actions to reinstate respect concerning the norms and procedures re democracy and human rights in a number of areas: constitutional, investigation of HR violations, local democracy, public assembly, elections, capacity building for parliamentaties.

The development intervention's objective of the CoE Immediate Measures Package is to reinstate the respect for human rights and democracy in the wake of the recent violent events in Ukraine through legal expertise and support provision.

description.narrative: The Immediate Measures Package project was designed as a quick response programme to the Revolution of Dignity/Euromaidan developments in Ukraine in November 2013 - March 2014. It is commendable that the Council of Europe managed to quickly design a relevant and need-based programminging package in its core area of expertise. The organization provided quite an extensive menu of support in the area of rule of law, democracy and human rights, also via arranging direct helplines from all the relevant Council of Europe arms. The project lasted from April to December 2014, the total budget was €2 678 276. The project provided timely and relevant expert support as to effective investigation of massive human rights violations. The activities included support to International Advisory Panel investigating Euromaidan crimes, expert help to the government, civil society and legal profession as to enhancing investigation methodology, securing evidence, police records, support for the rehabilitation of victims etc. Council of Europe expertise was also instrumnetal for the development of the National Human Rights Strategy and Action Plan in Ukraine. Comprehensive support was provided to secure the rights of national minorities during the language policy reform, but also in relation to the annexation of Crimea (Crimean Tatars). This part of the project included a strong communication component, with good media coverage etc. CoE expert bodies were involved in the Constitutional and electoral reforms in 2014 (Venice Commission), practical help was provided as to enhancing the transparency and quality of the election process during 2014 Parliamentary and Presidential elections. More than 5,000 domestic observers received training on international election standards and report writing techniques, as well as media monitoring during elections. The policy framework for the large-scale decentralization reform was elaborated with the expert help of Council of Europe (law on voluntary amalgamation of communities, law on cooperation between territorial communities etc.). Capacity of the newly elected post-revolution Parliament was strenthened via training. Partnership with civil society became strategic and a comprehensive set of measures was applied to protect and empower civil society networks in Ukraine, better involve them in the policy process and in the development and approval of political decisions in Ukraine. A unique special measure of this package was the appointment of the CoE Secretary General's Special Advisor in Ukraine, based in the field. This Advisor played a coordinating role and continuously provided the Ukrainian authorities with support on national reforms, investing most efforts into justice and criminal procedure sectors.
